course.title: Android Java Masterclass - Become an App Developer
course.subtitle: Improve your career options by learning Android app Development. Master Android Studio and build your first app today

reviews.body: Lots of very useful material and knowledge, but its pretty slow going and project examples get very complex and drawn out to the point where a project becomes 8 hours and 100 videos for example at some points. At that point it gets more exhausting then helpful to watch...

Many thanks for a very interesting course. One really learns a lot. Unfortunately, a few things are no longer up to date - but this has the advantage that you get more involved with the topic. From my point of view 2 aspects are not well solved. The TaskTimer app is very complex. It would have been better to teach some concepts in smaller projects. Furthermore, the TaskTimer App was not programmed completely. The chapter for settings is missing. Nevertheless, anyone who wants to learn programming should take a look at this course. Some programming experience would be helpful.

It was a very good course for beginners who want to start learning android programming the right way. I learned a lot specially the fundamentals of building an android app.

There were some lectures that are a little bit outdated but if you research them online, you can find a workaround on it. The instructors are also responsive if you have any questions so there's no reason not to ask them. Thank you Tim and Jean for this very good course!
Great course, I've learned a ton, and while I've not built my own apps yet (...having just finished the course), I'm already using the info Tim has provided to be a better programmer.

It was really awesome! Topics were explained really good. I like the the tips the he gave in the courses.

One suggestion, it would have been really good if it was told like what we are going to achieve in each lesson before the lesson start with some examples.

Thank you!

One of the Best Course for the People, Who are Really Interested in Android app Development, Special Thanks to Sir Tim Buchalka and the rest of Supporting Instructors and really appreciate their work...

The course is really good! But with "but"s.

+ The content of this course is VERY big, valuable, lots of useful techniques, unobvious approaches, Android lifehacks and design tricks.

+ Jean-Paul usually replies questions very fast and this is a great support!

+ Tim speaks on video with optimal speed: many lecturers speek too slow and make course too long, not in this case. This means, more information is packed in these 60 hours of lectures.

- MANY times I was like, "what`s going on?" because the explanation style is: "coding on screen, telling what the code does". This is master class, yes, not a definitive course of lectures, but more visual material (e.g. illustrating how different parts of Android ecosystem work) would be of great help. Tables with app structure helped a lot, but there are just a few of them.

- Course has a cliffhanger "we will make app settings in the next video" and there`s no next video, it is the end of the course. (as of 31.07.2020). I hope it will be finished.

Conclusion: I would recommend this course to any person who is gonna be Android developer, though not as a first, "introduction" course.

Explanations are very detailed. Great for beginners who know nothing about Java or Android programming. Provides tips and tricks as well on what are the best ways to do certain things. Lectures are interwoven with practices to ensure you really understand what is being taught.

After the course I understood the main concepts while making and APP. Understanding the Content Provider and Adapter classes are still little difficult for me. However the other concepts are OK. Looking forward to learning, creating Apps with Kotlin. Since I do not know Kotlin, I will most probably take up the begineer level course.
Best course for android java developers.

He has very knowledge and experience in the programming life. Therefore, When he explain some codes or write code, he tells us very briefly and we can pick up quickly. Of course, Lots of libraries is old and it causes to get errors while program is running. But if you write codes by typing, you can't get any error. I think this course doesn't include things about gaming coding but (I think) if you want to get a job as Android Developer, it is very useful course to reach your goal.Just have a problem that we need to code "Setting" menu in last lecture but he finished this course and There is no make sense to creating "Duration" column in Durations Report menu. Because we just get random duration and Making counter for duration and notifying to user would be nice. Everything else is good. Thanks for everything Tim...

Unfortunately, in 2020 this course is completely outdated and in fact it teaches to do things in a wrong, unnecessarily complicated way.

On top of that, if anyone thinks seriously about Android development then Kotlin is the language to go for.

I loved Tim's Java Masterclass course, in my opinion he is a great teacher, but unless there is a new course, like from scratch new, with JETPACK, MVVM, Android Studio 4.0+ features I would discourage anyone from buying the courses (both Java and Kotlin).

instructor.name: Tim Buchalka
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Tim's been a professional software developer for over 35 years.  During his career, he has worked for major companies such as Fujitsu, Mitsubishi, and Saab.

His video courses are used to train developers in major companies such as Mercedes-Benz, Paypal, VW, Pitney Bowes, IBM, and T-Mobile just to name a few (via the Udemy for Business program).

What makes Tim unique is his professional programming career - many instructors have never programmed professionally, let alone had a distinguished professional development career like Tim.

Tim has trained over 851,000 students how to program, way more than a typical IT Professor at a college does in a lifetime.

In fact, Tim's courses are often purchased by students struggling to get through college programming courses.

"I am learning a lot about Java very quickly. I wish my college courses worked this way, they drag the same amount of material out over months." - Thomas Neal

"I love this guy. I'm in school for java right now at a local college and I bought this course hoping it would help clarify the fuzzy areas of my coursework. There's no comparison. Every time I get lost in my textbook, I watch a couple more of these videos and I'm right back on track. He explains everything so perfectly. It sinks right in." - Kristen Andreani

In fact, I was able to find a job as Java developer with the knowledge gained from this course, so I basically owe Mr. Buchalka my career" - Daniel KubÃ¡nyi

Tim's mission is simple:  to make a difference in your life by helping you to become a software developer.  Tim does that through his Java, Python, C#, Spring Framework, and Android development courses.

When Tim started programming over thirty-five years ago, there was no online video training.  

There was no "easy" way to learn.  The Internet, in its current form, didn't exist, and as a result, Tim couldn't "Google" for help, or watch videos on Youtube.

After learning the hard way, Tim was determined to become the best teacher he could, and to make his training as painless as possible, so that you, or anyone else with the desire to become a software developer, could become one.

In between doing that, Tim spent the best part of those years as a professional software developer writing applications in Java and a variety of other languages.  In addition, he spent many years with J2EE (as it was then known), now known as Java Enterprise Edition (JEE), designing and developing enterprise applications.

Tim is relatively unique, in that he is a professional, experienced software developer who also has exceptional teaching skills.  

Many instructors have no work experience in the field.  Make sure the person you trust with your education is a real expert with substantial previous professional experience.

The bottom line for you is, when taking any of Tim's courses, is that you will learn the right way to do things from an expert, in the shortest possible amount of time.

Tim's Java, Android, and Python courses, here on Udemy are of the highest quality as reviewed by his students.   Ten's of thousands of students, just like you, have taken his classes, thousands have left glowing reviews, and many have gone on to full-time jobs, or consulting/freelancing opportunities after completing one of his courses.

Tim recently placed in the top ten Udemy instructors as voted for by his students and Udemy themselves.  

What does all of this mean for you?

You can have full confidence that Tim's courses are of exceptional quality, and that he can teach you to become a software developer if you have the desire to become one.

Are you ready to start?  You can get started today.  No previous experience is necessary.

In 2020, video training is the quickest way to learn, and with Tim's experience and training, it is possible for you to become a software developer.  You can do this.
